meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a vampire.
meanings.sent1: The dark cloak gave him a vampirish appearance.
meanings.sent2: Her pale skin and red lips made her look vampirish.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his friend's love for tomato juice was vampirish.
meanings.sent4: The way he drained his coffee cup reminded her of a vampirish thirst.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the old castle felt vampirish.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or behaviors associated with vampires.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious stranger had a vampirish charm about him.
meanings.sent2: She had a vampirish habit of staying up all night.
meanings.sent3: The way he avoided sunlight was vampirish in nature.
meanings.sent4: Her craving for rare steak was almost vampirish.
meanings.sent5: The way he moved stealthily through the shadows was truly vampirish.
